abstracts.cdata!:
The project outcome was satisfactory,
            sustainability likely, and the institutional development
            impact substantial. Lessons address: 1) the substantial
            cost, and time overruns were due to underestimated technical
            complexities in the construction, and operation of the
            expressway. Hence, it is cost-effective to refine
            engineering designs, of both for the expressway, and the
            electrical, and mechanical systems (EMS) component.
            Similarly, procurement of EMS works should start at least
            two years before completion of civil works; 2) while the
            Trucking Study identified the barriers to long-distance
            traffic, and recommended long-distance trade facilitation,
            the National Trunk Highway System (NTHS) enhanced
            inter-provincial cooperation, key lessons the Bank undertook
            for promoting trade, initiating a series of national highway
            projects, by grouping provinces traversed by a long section
            of the NTHS; 3) both the Northwest Henan roads, and the road
            improvement program components achieved significant benefits
            under the rural roads programs, including community
            appreciation for this type of involvement, a lesson
            confirmed by the success of the road improvement for poverty
            alleviation component in the follow-up project, and its
            effectiveness in targeting poverty.
